The date and source of the image: The expert's verdict mentions that the image was published on Facebook on March 7, 2020. This provides a specific date and source for the claim, allowing for verification.
Description of the image: The expert's verdict provides a detailed description of the image, including the presence of an individual wearing a white gown administering an injection to another person dressed in military fatigues. This description helps in identifying the content of the image and determining its relevance to the claim.
Text accompanying the image: The expert's verdict includes the English and Chinese text present in the image. This text claims that China has developed a COVID-19 vaccine and provides additional details about the vaccine administration and the individuals involved. Analyzing the text helps in evaluating the authenticity of the claim.
Corroborating evidence and statements: The expert's verdict mentions various additional sources and statements that support or refute the claim. These include the AFP report on the spread of COVID-19, the sharing of the image on multiple social media platforms, the tweet from Chinese state media labeling the claim as "FAKENEWS," and the post from The People's Daily debunking the claim. Considering these pieces of evidence helps in verifying the authenticity of the claim.
